plan: In the next rounds, I’ll test the dominant strategy of bidding my exact value to understand its effectiveness. I’ll also experiment with underbidding slightly below my value occasionally to minimize losses while observing competitors’ tendencies. Additionally, I’ll explore overbidding in small increments above my value against conservative opponents to identify potential gain opportunities. I will adjust my strategies based on the observed patterns from Bidder Betty and Bidder Charles, experimenting with riskier tactics like aggressive overbidding when my value is near $99, to seize high-value prizes. The insights gained will refine my approach for maximizing long-term profit.

My plan involves testing various bidding strategies while keeping long-term profit maximization in mind. Initially, I will employ the dominant strategy by bidding my exact value to gather baseline data. Subsequently, I will explore bidding slightly below my value to minimize potential losses when my value is high. Conversely, for low values, I will bid slightly above my value to test aggressive tactics' effectiveness. These experiments will inform adjustments based on opponent behavior patterns observed over rounds, aiming to enhance strategic decision-making in future bids.

I'll document results to discern patterns and refine strategies. This approach balances risk and data collection, seeking optimal outcomes over several rounds.
